sub_title: Compassion and Value for Nature and Living Beings I                   PhD Candidate at the RMI  I  Sustainability Management at ettics I  Organisational Development and Learning at Candour
summary:
Hi there :) 

Nice that you came across! Feel free to reach out if there is interest or common ground.

My biggest passion is a fair and sustainable fashion industry, changing towards a Social Circular Economy that values people, animals and the planet. 
 
Aiming towards that change, I try to make use of my greatest strengths which are solving problems, reaching out to people and connecting the right dots. So far this really supported me in doing great things in collaboration with people. I particularly love to work with fashion brands to see how to proactively engage in social and environmental challenges and explore new approaches to reduce uncertainties and step into action.
 
The integration between my applied science studies in Fashion Management, my practical experience in Bangladesh and Tanzania, combined with the Master of Science in Global Management of Social Issues create a wonderful synergy that enables me to work on multiple wonderful projects. 

My primary focus lies in promoting collaborative learning among diverse stakeholders within the fashion industry, as well as within organizations themselves. I firmly believe that a collaborative and compassionate approach, valuing both people and the planet, is crucial as it creates a space where limitless possibilities can emerge :)

Feel free to leave me a message! I am always up for new ideas and awesome projects.

treasury_media.title: AMD Absolventin gewinnt Förderpreis: Raphaela Fritz im Interview
treasury_media.description: Nachhaltigkeit und faire Arbeitsbedingungen sind das große Lebensthema von Raphaela Fritz, Mode- und Designmanagement (B.A.) Absolventin an der AMD Berlin. Für ihre Bachelorarbeit mit dem Titel „Social Business Compliance – (gezielt und leicht) erlernbar?“ wurde die 24-jährige von der renommierten Wilhelm Lorch Stiftung ausgezeichnet.

education.field_of_study: MSc Global Management of Social Issues
education.grade: 9.5 (Dutch Academic Grading; Master's Thesis Award 2021; Best Master Student)

projects.title: Screening of the Documentary „The True Cost“ Followed by a Discussion Round
projects.description:
Screening of the movie “The True Cost” followed by a discussion round 
The goal was to raise awareness for environmental and social issues in the RMG sector.
As sustainability isn’t a main focus in fashion and management studies, I organised with a fellow student a screening of the documentary “The True Cost” followed by a discussion round. The documentary is a great opportunity to raise awareness amongst the fellow students and talk about the huge impact of social and environmental issues associated with mass production.

profile_positions.description: ettics is an eco-fair retailing brand based in Germany. At our concept stores in Witten, Dortmund and Bochum we are selling our own ettics brand but also many other beautiful eco-fair fashion brands. We only have brands in our assortment that inspire us, offering clothes which are high-quality and fair for people and nature. To achieve value in the upstream and downstream supply chain, I support our team in sustainability and circularity strategies as well as in sustainable sourcing practices.
profile_positions.title: Sustainability & Sourcing

profile_positions.description:
I am working as Research Associate and PhD Candidate at the Reinhard Mohn Institute of Management (RMI) at the University Witten/Herdecke. Part of my role is organising activities concerning the institution and teaching courses such as Inter-organisational Alliances and Networks and Managing a Circular Economy. 

My doctoral project explores the topic of compassion organising as change mechanism within the fashion industry. Pre-liminary title 'Organising Emotion Work for Institutional Transformation: How can Compassion Enable a Circular Economy in the Fashion Industry?'
profile_positions.title: PhD Candidate and Research Associate at the Reinhard Mohn Institute of Management

profile_positions.description:
Hakizetu aims to empower young women and girls and thereby end gender-based violence while supporting women's rights. 

I learn so much from my colleagues at Hakizetu about Sexual and Reproductive Rights and their approach to improving the situation, as well as about the cultural norms and beliefs of Tanzanians. 

At Hakizetu I am responsible for 'Organisational Development and Learning'. This role encompasses on the one side responsibilities such as developing impact measures and a theory of change, researching and consultation, writing funding proposals etc. On the other side, I am also responsible for engaging and educating the community about SRH and Hakizetu's work. This includes working on social media strategies on how to include the community in our day-to-day work, educate them about SRH, show them real-life stories of women and girls who faced gender-based violence while also showing what we as individuals can do to change the current status quo while supporting new values and beliefs.
profile_positions.title: Consultant Organisational Development and Learning

profile_positions.description:
Fashion Revolution is a global movement that was initiated after the Rana Plaza collapse in 2013. Fashion Revolution celebrates fashion as a positive influence while also scrutinising industry practices and raising awareness of the fashion industry’s most pressing issues. We aim to show that change is possible and encourage those who are on a journey to create a more ethical and sustainable future for fashion. 

I am the Initiator and Head of the Fashion Revolution Group in Tilburg. With our regional group we foster sustainability in the garment and textile industry by making the customers aware of their impact. We particularly focus on in-depth insights by presenting interviews but also sharing experiences and impression of the status quo and improvements. 

Follow us on Instagram: fashrev_tilburg
https://www.instagram.com/fashrev_tilburg/
profile_positions.title: Fashion Revolution Student Ambassador and Head of Fashion Revolution Tilburg

profile_positions.description:
I had the great opportunity to work as a Student Assistant at the Department of Organization Studies at Tilburg University.

I was responsible for two main functions under which I did several tasks. For the course Innovation, Entrepreneurship and Organization (IOE), I supervised and guided workgroups through their process of writing reports on specific tasks and graded them afterwards. Furthermore, I assisted in research on impact investing. I worked on a literature review needed for a book chapter about the state of academic research about impact investing.

During my employment I developed and improved very nicely my skills on teaching, supervising, grading, academic research and writing but also got insights into how a department at a university is operating.
profile_positions.title: Student Assistant at the Department of Organization Studies

profile_positions.description:
I lived one year in Bangladesh and worked with the Netherlands-based Non-Profit, Multistakeholder Organisation Fair Wear Foundation (FWF).  Particularly, I worked on the Workplace Education Programme (WEP) which FWF is implementing in garment factories in order to reduce harassment issues. Furthermore, I did, based on audit reports of the member factories, an analysis on gender-related issues in the export-oriented garment industry in Bangladesh. I also supported the team in editing reports, writing reports, research and document elements of FWF BDs work.

Project 'Workplace Education Programme (WEP)'
Analysis 'Gender-related issues in export-oriented RMG production in Bangladesh'

I got many great insights into the work of FWF from the production country side. Besides the important insights into the export-garment factories and the work for FWF, I could see the issues in the industry from a less western angle which helps me now to think ideas and approaches better through. Many things we see as logical from our western angle, seems to make not much sense to implement in so different cultures and countries such as Bangladesh. This developed cultural competence is one of the most valuable asset I gained during my time in Dhaka.
profile_positions.title: Researcher and Project Assistant of the Workplace Education Programme (WEP)

profile_positions.description:
At the beginning of my time in Dhaka, I supported the local NGO Bangladesh Labour Foundation (BLF). BLF is committed to protect of the rights of all workers, create a productive and economic independent society that's free from poverty, discrimination and where people can exercise their basic social and human rights, social justice through activities that focus on youth and women, children and working people of Bangladesh.

I supported the local NGO on the projects in the tannery and the local garments: 
- „Strengthening knowledge, awareness, and advocacy on social and environmental conditions and established labour standards for workers in the leather-based value chain“
- „Improving the capacity of the workers in the workplace to ensure decent work in the Local Market RMG in Bangladesh“

The projects took place at the New Tannery (Hemayetpur, Savar) and Local RMG Factories (Keranigonj)  for which we also visited the field sites for the project implementation.

During my time in Dhaka I had the great opportunity to see the entire fashion industry. With BLF I could  gain insights into the leather and local garment production, whereas my work later at FWF showed me the industry from the export-garment side.
profile_positions.title: Project Assistant

profile_positions.description:
Mankii Vintage is a Berlin-based luxury vintage shop selling vintage clothing, jewellery and accessories. 
I worked next to my bachelor studies for over 2,5 years in the position as a Sales Manager. I gained valuable knowledge, experience and skills in sales, sales advice, presentation of goods, merchandise, quality management, B2C, costumer experience and sensitivity for sales strategies.
profile_positions.title: Sales Manager

profile_positions.description: Sergeant Pepper is a Berlin-based corporate fashion label that specialises in modern and high-quality B2B clothing. During the internship, I was involved in different departments and tasks. First I supported the team in quality management. This included tasks such as quality assurance, documentation of production variance, commissioning of products etc. In the production management department we also responsible for making product sheets in Excel, preparation for manufacturing and item production material sourcing etc. Later I was involved with the project management department where I was partly responsible for the creation of concepts and catalogues or presentations for customers. For my work I often used the programmes Photoshop, InDesign and Illustrator.
profile_positions.title: Product Management, Project Management

volunteer_experiences.description: Enactus Tilburg recognises social, economic and ecological issues in Tilburg and uses social entrepreneurship in order to solve these. I consulted the group Chic Amis which focused on fashion waste and closing the loop of the fashion cycles. The group decided to work on a business model to rent out evening wardrobe and selling second-hand clothes for cheap prices to students. In my role as consultant I observe the group dynamics, talk about new ideas with the group and giving the members feedback on their process.

I was part if the STAI - Amnesty International Student Group at Tilburg University. I was member of Symposium Committee in which we organised projects such as a Discussion Night on the Topic Abortion (December 2019), Discussion Night on the Topic Gender Inequality (February 2020) etc.

I was a member of the group “against human rights violations to women”. We worked mainly for raising awareness and campaigning on the topic of violations against women around the world. We organised events (movie screening, discussion rounds, poetry slam etc.) and events to encourage people to sign petitions.

company.name: A Heart for Homeless (Ein Herz für Obdachlose)

volunteer_experiences.description:
Every Tuesday a group of volunteers called 'A Heart for Homeless' distributed food, drinks and clothes at the railway station at the mission 'Zoologischer Garten' in Berlin. Besides the distribution, a great value for the homeless is the social contact with people and someone who listens to them and their stories.
This voluntary experience and the homeless taught me many valuable things about life. I am very thankful that I was able to be a member of this group.
